name: $si
desc: Any Building or structure. This may contain rooms, corridors, wings, etc. It may not have walls, or a roof, but is considered a defined/allocated space.

name: $bu
desc: A Wing within a Building, this often contains levels, rooms and corridors.

name: $wi
desc: A Ward is a section of a medical facility that may contain rooms and other types of location.

name: $wa
desc: A Level in a multi-level Building/Structure.

name: $lvl
desc: Any corridor within a Building, that may connect rooms.

name: $co
desc: A space that is allocated as a room, it may have walls/roof etc., but does not require these.

name: $ro
desc: A space that is allocated for sleeping/laying on. This is not the physical bed/trolley that may be moved about, but the space it may occupy.

name: $ve
desc: A residential dwelling. Usually used to reference a location that a person/patient may reside.

name: $ho
desc: A container that can store goods, equipment, medications or other items.

name: $ca
desc: A defined path to travel between 2 points that has a known name.

name: $rd
desc: A defined physical boundary of something, such as a flood risk zone, region, postcode

name: $area
desc: A wide scope that covers a conceptual domain, such as a Nation (Country wide community or Federal Government - e.g. Ministry of Health),  Province or State (community or Government), Business (throughout the enterprise), Nation with a business scope of an agency (e.g. CDC, FDA etc.) or a Business segment (UK Pharmacy), not just an physical boundry
